DOC.brief_summary: Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome (OSAS) regardless of any other associated risk factor can lead to accelerated aging. The study of aging-related Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) is difficult because of associated risk factors (diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidemia, obesity), promoting themselves aging. The investigators propose to compare a group of OSAS patients free of any associated pathology, to subjects matched for age, sex, smoking and body mass index (BMI)
DOC.brief_title: Accelerated Aging in Middle-Aged Men With Sleep-disordered Breathing.
